image.altText: The SA flag flies above South Australia's Parliament House.

props.synopsis: South Australia's upper house has narrowly voted down a proposal to amend abortion laws so that people who want to terminate their pregnancy after 28 weeks would be required to deliver their baby alive.

title.children: Late-term abortion bill defeated in SA with controversy over MP votes

image.altText: PJ Harvey performs live on stage at the State Theatre on January 18, 2012 in Sydney, Australia.

props.synopsis: Two-time Mercury-award-winning artist PJ Harvey will bring her live show to Australia for the first time in eight years for WOMADelaide.

title.children: PJ Harvey, Nils Frahm and more announced on WOMADelaide 2025 line up

image.altText: A power tower in a paddock.

props.synopsis: A severe storm has left Broken Hill and the surrounding region without power and the power infrastructure company says it could take weeks to fix the damage.

title.children: Outback city running on generators after wild storm crumples transmission towers

image.altText: Two oval containers with white pouches and golden pouches on a background of yellow and orange graphic.

props.synopsis: Teens say an illegal nicotine product is easy to procure, leaving experts calling for better enforcement.

title.children: These products make you 'very sick' and 'lethargic' so why are teens turning to it?

image.altText: A waterway closed over by sand.

props.synopsis: A freak storm brought nearly 100,000 cubic metres of sand into the entrance of Cape Jaffa's marina, but the South Australian government says it can't help the local council.

title.children: Popular marina closed off by enough sand to fill nearly 40 Olympic pools

image.altText: Storm clouds brewing at night, with shades of blue and green, over green pastures

props.synopsis: A spell of wild weather is on the cards for everywhere from Queensland to Tasmania, with thunderstorms forecast to sweep across Australia's east over the next 48 hours.

title.children: Wild weather predicted across Australia's south-east over next 48 hours

image.altText: A rocket flies over farmland

props.synopsis: A Canadian company has signed a deal to test its rocket in South Australia next year. If successful, it will be the first time a rocket reaches space from the remote Koonibba base.

title.children: Tiny South Australian town to host first rocket launch to space

image.altText: Hainsworth

props.synopsis: A five-hour police interview with accused serial killer Steven Hainsworth reveals his DNA was found at the scene of his aunt's murder and that he pawned some of her belongings within hours of her death.

title.children: Police grill alleged triple murderer in recorded interview

image.altText: Moon rising over hills on horizon.

props.synopsis: Our skies have already been graced by two supermoons this year but tonight's hunter's moon will be the brightest.

title.children: Everything to know about the year's brightest supermoon set to light up skies tonight

image.altText: Stephen Mitchell sits at a cafe holding a take-away coffee cup.

props.synopsis: Stephen Mitchell is already serving a jail term for sexual offences against six girls during his time as a national rock climbing coach.

title.children: 'He took advantage of me': Convicted paedophile is given more jail time for separate act of indecency

image.altText: Widodo smiling and waving

props.synopsis: A 75 per cent approval rating is unimaginable to incumbent leaders in most other democracies around the world.

title.children: Indonesia's Jokowi has his critics, but leaves office more popular than any leader before him

image.altText: A grey US B-2 stealth bomber attack aircraft seen flying through the rear entry of another military plane.

props.synopsis: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin described the strikes as a "unique demonstration" against the country's adversaries.

title.children: US bombers target underground Houthi bunkers

image.altText: James Davis wearing a cap

props.synopsis: James-Robert Davis's former partner said she was tattooed, forced to wear a collar, and told to sign a contract making her a "slave", while she was subjected to his control.

title.children: Man accused of running a sex cult on a rural NSW property jailed for assaulting woman he 'enslaved'

image.altText: Russian rescuers dressed in reflective safety clothing carrying a man dressed in blue in a hammock stretcher.

props.synopsis: Mikhail Pichugin spent 67 days battling the cold and drinking rainwater, but the two relatives who were in the boat with him both died.

title.children: Man survives months stranded at sea after Siberian whale watching trip goes wrong

image.altText: Riverlea

props.synopsis: Part of the Riverlea development was brought to a halt after Indigenous remains were found at the $3 billion housing estate last year. Now the SA government has given developers the go ahead, with conditions, in what one senior Kaurna woman has described as "bittersweet".

title.children: Aboriginal remains were found at this housing development. Now, construction can resume

image.altText: man gather in a street

props.synopsis: Lebanon's second-largest city, Tripoli, has largely been spared the Israeli air strikes smashing the country's south, Beqaa Valley and southern Beirut. But, the influx of refugees has exposed ongoing tensions in the country between its Shia, Sunni and Christian communities.

title.children: In Lebanon, some towns fear Hezbollah members are among the Shia refugees pouring in

image.altText: M1A1 Abrams tank

props.synopsis: The announcement was welcomed by Ukraine's ambassador to Australia, Vasyl Myroshnychenko.

title.children: Australia will send 49 old tanks to Ukraine, more than a year after they first asked for them

image.altText: A man stands on the front porch of a house, behind a sign that says 'Trump 2024'.

props.synopsis: Soon after Donald Trump claimed Haitian migrants were eating cats and dogs in Ohio, he turned his attention to another part of the US.

title.children: 'Not so beautiful now': After amplifying a pet-eating conspiracy, Trump took aim at migrants in another town

props.synopsis: US Vice-President Kamala Harris has been grilled in a televised interview on the Biden administration's efforts to tackle a surge in illegal immigration at the southern border, blaming Republicans for failing to pass a border bill.

title.children: Kamala Harris pressed on immigration, Biden's fitness for office in first interview with Fox News

image.altText: A picture of the outside of The Star Casino in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The NSW Independent Casino Commission (NICC) has imposed a range of conditions on The Star and will re-assess its suitability to regain its casino licence by March 31 next year.

title.children: Sydney's The Star casino handed $15m fine and licence to remain suspended, watchdog says

image.altText: a grandmother, daughter and grandaughter on a horse in an equestrian competition.

props.synopsis: Country shows are about more than rides and show bags. Many say they are a lifeline for farmers and regional communities doing it tough.

title.children: What agricultural shows mean to farming communities during tough seasons

image.altText: Selfie of a man wearing a cap and safety gear inside a helicopter

props.synopsis: Being given just six months to live came as a shock to Craig Pankhurst because he assumed not hearing from the doctor about his most recent prostate-specific antigen test was a good thing. But it wasn't.

title.children: It shouldn't have taken a 'crook tooth' for Craig to learn he had life-threatening prostate cancer

image.altText: Andrew and Nicola stand side by side on the Perth foreshore

props.synopsis: Andrew and Nicola Forrest are stepping down from the philanthropic foundation they founded together, with the news coming just over a year after they announced their marriage separation.

title.children: Andrew, Nicola Forrest to step down from philanthropic organisation Minderoo, a year after separating as a couple

image.altText: Troy Bell walks outside a court building holding a note pad.

props.synopsis: Independent Mount Gambier MP Troy Bell says he will fight the jury's guilty verdicts and hopes to clear his name while continuing to represent his community.

title.children: MP found guilty of fraud offences vows to clear his name

image.altText: An older couple smile, standing in a kitchen holding kitchen utensils over a pot full of food.

props.synopsis: The latest Foodbank Hunger Report has found 3.4 million households across Australia are experiencing food insecurity, with low income earners having to skip meals or eat less because they cannot afford enough food.

title.children: These pensioners feed vulnerable families. They're seeing a disturbing trend that's been echoed in a new hunger report

image.altText: A man wearing a green jacket and hat holding tomatoes.

props.synopsis: Tomato growers placed into quarantine after the discovery of the tomato brown rugose virus say authorities should have been better prepared for the arrival of the virus.

title.children: 'Devastated': Tens of millions of dollars in losses smash Australian tomato farmers

image.altText: An older man with a vibrant shirt sits by a kitchen bench with a sullen look on his face, holding a piece of paper

props.synopsis: Clients of Netstrata have told the ABC the strata firm has begun uploading years of invoices, with brokerage fees up to six times industry standard.

title.children: 'My jaw was hanging off': Mysterious invoices reveal exorbitant fees charged to apartment owners

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: Australia's national unemployment rate remained steady in September at 4.1 per cent. The share market closed on another record high. Catch up on the day's business and markets news in the live blog.

title.children: ASX closes on fresh record high, strong jobs numbers dampen talk of early rate cuts — as it happened

image.altText: A politician speaking to the media.

props.synopsis: David Speirs, who held the role of SA opposition leader for almost two-and-a-half years, formally quits parliament 10 days after he revealed police had arrested him on suspicion of drug offences.

title.children: Former Liberal leader officially quits SA parliament days after police said he was facing drug charges

image.altText: The 23andMe logo seen on a smartphone.

props.synopsis: In what now seems like an act of reckless naivety, I bought my brother a 23andMe at-home DNA-test birthday present. Now the struggling company may sell its treasure trove of genetic data.

title.children: As 23andMe faces bankruptcy, your genetic data could be sold to highest bidder

image.altText: Erik Menendez (R) and brother Lyle listen to court proceedings during a May 17, 1991 appearance.

props.synopsis: Several of the family members say that in today's world — which is more aware of the impact of sexual abuse — Erik and Lyle Menendez would not have been jailed for the rest of their lives.

title.children: 'Today we know better': Family say Menendez brothers should have got lenient sentences

image.altText: A grey and white little fluffy Greater gliders on a gum tree  branch looking ahead with big round eyes and a long fluffy tail.

props.synopsis: Logging is set to continue in areas where hundreds of endangered gliders have been sighted, despite conservationists warning the government regulator of their presence.

title.children: Logging set to continue in areas where hundreds of endangered gliders are present

image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing glasses walks down a street while being filmed by TV cameras.

props.synopsis: Sam Einfeld is sentenced to an intensive corrections order of one year and nine months for the attack on 82-year-old Margot Priday, just days after being sentenced for two other counts of common assault against his own elderly mother and another woman.

title.children: Former councillor sentenced for 'violent, senseless and unprovoked' attack on 82yo woman

image.altText: Dan Houston of the Power celebrates victory, raising his arms above his head

props.synopsis: After a week and a half of furrowed brows and frantic paperwork, the dust has begun to settle on a new footy future for all 18 AFL clubs.

title.children: How to assess which clubs improved or failed in the AFL trade period
